intro: Echinopsis densispina f. citriniflora, commonly known as the Citriniflora Echinopsis, is a succulent cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems and dense, spiny ribs. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid gardens and as a houseplant.
